intro: Foullioya maritima, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant thrives in salty, well-drained soils and is often found in dunes or rocky shores. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Foullioya maritima is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that plays an important role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
